3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **

8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **

12   |  ** 									     **

14   |  **			rent user level					     **
15   |  ** 									     **

60   | 
61   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
62   | 
63   | /**
64   |  **  names for the user level
65   |  **/
66   | 
67   | static	char	_str_ul_novice[] = "novice";
68   | static	char	_str_ul_advanced[] = "advanced";
69   | static	char	_str_ul_expert[] = "expert";
70   |

72   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/

77   | 
78   | /*++++
79   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   Function:		cmdModuleUser					     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'info'			     **
84   |  ** 									     **
85   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
88   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
89   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
90   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
93   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
94   |  ** 									     **
95   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
96   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
97   |  **					control everything		     **
98   |  ** 									     **
99   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
100  |  ++++*/
101  | 
102  | int cmdModuleUser(
103  | 	ClientData client_data,
104  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
105  | 	int objc,
106  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
107  | ) {
108  |     /**
109  |      **  Whatis mode?
110  |      **/
111  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
112  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
113  |     /**
114  |      **  Parameter check
115  |      **/
116  | 	if (objc < 2) {
117  | 		if (OK !=
118  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
119  | 				"level ", NULL))
120  | 			return (TCL_ERROR);
121  | 					/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
122  | 	}
123  |     /**
124  |      **  Non-persist mode?
125  |      **/
126  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
127  | 		return (TCL_OK);
128  | 	}
129  |     /**
130  |      **  Display mode?
131  |      **/
132  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
133  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
134  | 		while (--objc)
135  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
136  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
137  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
138  | 	}
139  |     /**
140  |      **  Change the user level
141  |      **/
142  | 	return (cmdModuleUser_sub((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[1])));
143  | 
144  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleUser' **/
145  |     
146  | 
147  | /*++++
148  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
149  |  ** 									     **
150  |  **   Function:		cmdModuleUser_sub				     **
151  |  ** 									     **
152  |  **   Description:	Check the user level passed as argument and set up   **
153  |  **			the global user level flag			     **
154  |  ** 									     **
155  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
156  |  ** 									     **
157  |  **   Parameters:	char	*user_level	User level string to be chk. **
158  |  ** 									     **
159  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
160  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
161  |  ** 									     **
162  |  **   Attached Globals:	sw_userlvl	Contains the binary coded userlevel  **
163  |  ** 									     **
164  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
165  |  ++++*/
166  | 
167  | int	cmdModuleUser_sub(	char	*user_level)
168  | {
169  |     char *s;
170  |     int len_arg;
171  | 
172  |     len_arg = strlen( user_level);
173  |     s = user_level;
174  |     while( s && *s) {
175  | 	*s = tolower( *s);
176  | 	s++;
177  |     }
178  | 
179  |     if( !strncmp( user_level, _str_ul_novice, len_arg)) {
180  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_NOVICE;
181  |     } else if( !strncmp( user_level, _str_ul_advanced, len_arg)) {
182  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_ADVANCED;
183  |     } else if( !strncmp( user_level, _str_ul_expert, len_arg)) {
184  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_EXPERT;
185  |     } else {
186  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USERLVL, LOC, user_level, NULL))
187  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);			/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
188  |     }
189  | 
190  |     /**
191  |      **  Success
192  |      **/
193  | 
194  |     return( TCL_OK);
195  | 
196  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleUser_sub' **/
